item.title: The Inner Conflict
item.description: The Inner Conflict # Have you ever had this monologue play inside your head? ‚ÄúI want to show up. I want to create, share, and be part of the online community I quietly admire.‚Äù But when it‚Äôs time to hit publish, you freeze. Your mind floods with doubt: What if I‚Äôm not good enough? What if people see through me? What if I have nothing worth saying? WHAT IF I AM WRONG?

item.title: The Tech Magic Behind AWS: What Makes It Tick?
item.description: The Tech Magic Behind AWS: What Makes It Tick? # When it comes to cloud computing, AWS is like the Beyonc√© of the tech world ‚Äî powerful, everywhere, and always a little ahead of the curve. But what‚Äôs going on behind the scenes? Sure, you‚Äôve heard about the big stuff ‚Äî global infrastructure, scalability, the shared security model ‚Äî but I want to take you deeper into the AWS kitchen.

item.title: AWS Global Infrastructure
item.description: AWS Global Infrastructure # This blog will guide you on the right path to understanding cloud infrastructure. By the end, you‚Äôll have a clear understanding of how AWS Global Infrastructure operates to deliver its services efficiently. As discussed in my previous blog on virtualization, we understand that ultimately, it‚Äôs all about managing key computing resources like CPU, RAM, networking, and GPU. But how does AWS manage such a vast infrastructure?

item.title: Virtualization & Cloud Computing
item.description: Virtualization & Cloud Computing # This blog is a part of series I would be writing for beginners to learn and dive deeper into cloud computing, security & DevSecOps. After going through this series, you will be able to comprehend the concept of cloud computing & AWS, also work towards deploying applications in cloud infrastructure. But before understanding about cloud, you do need to have basic knowledge of how operating system works & a bit of networking.

item.title: Beginner friendly Hand-on Project on AWS S3 ‚Äî Part 1
item.description: I want to help beginner gain some confident on their journey in cloud and tech. I will be posting tutorials and lessons on cloud tech and security such that its more understandable and have not burden but fun and easy to comprehend. Let‚Äôs start with a service provided by AWS, called Amazon S3. You ever heard about S3? No! Ever used Google Drive to store your files online? Yes! It‚Äôs a primary example of how object storage works.

item.title: How DNS works? Where do we see it, or we don‚Äôt!
item.description: How DNS works? Where do we see it, or we don‚Äôt! # DNS or we say Domain Name System, has quietly weaves its magic in our daily online lives, like backstage crew making theatrical performance seamless. DNS is the reason you can effortlessly type ‚Äúgoogle.com‚Äù into your browser, instead of memorizing cryptic numbers. It‚Äôs like dialing your friend with a saved contact in your phone; you don‚Äôt have to remember their number.

item.title: What's IaC (Infrastructure as a Code)¬†???
item.description: What’s IaC (Infrastructure as a Code)¬†??? Introduction Have you ever setup a virtual machine? You might know about using an ISO file to load in Oracle Virtual Box, going through all the steps on by one to install the ISO on the Virtual Hard-Disk and that’s a lot of time being wasted. Well, to save some time you might have backed up you VM (of course Virtual Machine) and used OVA to load your VM.
